sentences.sContent: We will have to consider your offer carefully .
sentences.sCn: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.sContent: ...81% of paper product users said they would consider buying recycled toilet tissue if it were comparable in quality to standard paper...
...and 15% of people now consider themselves to be “cord-cutters...
...consider working as a study hall or a library monitor...
...Adults do not consider children's feelings when it comes to education...
...Laura Schmidt and Claire Brindis argue that it’s wrong to consider sugar just “empty calories...
...The publishing house has to consider the popularity of this novel...
...The American Psychiatric Association may consider listing Internet addiction in the next edition of its diagnostic manual...

words.tran: 相当大的；重要的，值得考虑的
经过深思熟虑的；被尊重的

trans.tranOther: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision
